title: Can somebody suggest me some good thriller novels to read like Dan Brown's (I have read all Dan's novel)? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you want something really close to Dan Brown, that will be a tough ask but two names spring to mind. Ian Caldwell - Just two books, start with The Rule of FourUmberto Eco - Thrillers, but with a complexity both in language and concepts that Dan Brown would not be able to match. Start with The Name of The Rose and work from there. There is also a Sean Connery movie on itI see that Raunaq’s answer has covered quite a few books, so I’ll just add a few of my own picks Eric Ambler’s Mask of Dimitrios,Bleeding Heart Square, Andrew TaylorFrozen Death, Bernard MinierBed Of Nails, Antonin VarenneA Foreign Country, Charles CummingAn Officer and a Spy, Robert HarrisDead Lions, Mick HerronThe Bourne Trilogy, Robert LudlumWorld at Night, Alan FurstThe Secret Agent, Joseph ConradIf you want to do this author wise, I would give a list as follows, Robert LudlumLen DeightonKen FollettWilbur SmithCormac MccarthyJohn Le CarreFrederick ForsythTom ClancyElmore LeonardApologies for the redundancies. Happy reading. Cheers.

Here are a list of thrillers which I would like to suggest: Spy Thrillers- The Spy Who Came in From the Cold, The Day of the Jackal, The Fourth Protocol.Military Thrillers- HMS Ulysses, Guns of Navarone, Scarecrow series by Matthew Reilly.Crime Thrillers- Any novel by Agatha Christie, preferably Murder on the Orient Express and And Then There Were None, The Hound of Baskervilles, The Godfather.Sci-Fi Thrillers- Prey, Timeline, Andromeda Strain, State of Fear (Basically anything my Michael Crichton)Legal Thrillers- Anything by John Grisham. But preferably, The Firm and The Rainmaker.PS: My personal suggestion would be, to drop down everything (not literally) and read The Godfather.

Cormoran Strike Series by Robert Galbraith (Pseudonym of J.K Rowling)The Cuckoo’s CallingThe SilkwormCareer Of EvilIf following a protagonist like Robert Langdon is your pick, Cormoran does share some traits with him. Grown up by Gillian FlynnThe only similarity is the excitement and the suprises, that too packed in a novella (around 100 pages).With almost certainty, it'll exceed your expectations Also winner of Edgar Allan Poe Award And There Were None by Agatha ChristieMy personal favorite Agatha Christie’s Book Sycamore RowUnlike other stories it doesn't have continuous mysterious relevations but rather a slow enticing theme. Have listed few similar page-turner thriller books.

You’ve started off well with Dan Brown’s novels. It’s a pleasure to read his works, though the storyline’s sometimes somewhat predictable. Nonetheless, he’s huge on thrill so get’s a pass! If you liked Brown then probably you’d find the following worth a read: Death Benefit—Robin CookHost—Robin CookThe Shadow of your Smile—Mary Higgins ClarkDaddy’s Little Girl—Mary Higgins ClarkThe Racketeer—John GrishamThe Rainmaker—John GrishamNo Country for Old Men—Cormac McCarthyHope you find this useful.

I would suggest you to go for Action/adventure : matthew reilly's Shane Schofield series. You would like it if you like mission impossible series.Clive cussler : dirk pit series if you like deep water adventure/actions.James Rollins : better than matthew reilly's in terms of spy thriller/ action/ adventure.Jules Verne : if you are interested in classic sci-fi.

Well, there's 'I Am Pilgrim’ by Terry Hayes and I'm sure if you love Dan Brown, you'll definitely fall in love with this spy thriller.

Almost all the novels of Agatha Christie are thrillers . Murder in the Orient express shouldn't be missed. Some novels of Sidney Sheldon ll be good thrillers., Bloodline , If tomorrow comes and doomsday conspiracy to name a few.
